Package io.sf.carte.doc.style.css.nsac

Interface LexicalUnit

public interface LexicalUnit
Based on SAC's LexicalUnit interface by Philippe Le Hegaret.

  • Field Summary

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    LexicalUnit clone()
    Creates a deep copy of this lexical unit and the next ones, but with getPreviousLexicalUnit() returning null.
    java.lang.String getCssText()
    Get a parsable representation of this unit.
    short getCssUnit()
    An integer indicating the type of css unit that this lexical value represents.
    java.lang.String getDimensionUnitText()
    If this unit is a SAC_DIMENSION, returns the string representation of the CSS unit returned by getCssUnit().
    float getFloatValue()
    Returns the float value represented by this unit.
    java.lang.String getFunctionName()
    Returns the name of the function.
    int getIntegerValue()
    Returns the integer value represented by this unit.
    short getLexicalUnitType()
    An integer indicating the type of LexicalUnit.
    LexicalUnit getNextLexicalUnit()
    The next lexical unit.
    LexicalUnit getParameters()
    The function parameters including operators (like the comma).
    LexicalUnit getPreviousLexicalUnit()
    The previous lexical unit.
    java.lang.String getStringValue()
    Returns the string value.
    LexicalUnit getSubValues()
    Returns a sequence of units inside the sub-expression or unicode range.
    void insertNextLexicalUnit​(LexicalUnit nextUnit)
    Insert the given unit as the next lexical unit.
    boolean isParameter()
    Check if this lexical unit is a parameter that was made available through its parent's getParameters() method.
    LexicalUnit replaceBy​(LexicalUnit replacementUnit)
    Replace this unit in the chain of lexical units.

      static final short SAC_RIGHT_BRACKET
      ]
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SAC_UNICODE_WILDCARD

      static final short SAC_UNICODE_WILDCARD
      Unicode range wildcard.

      For example: U+4??.

      The getStringValue() method returns the wildcard without the preceding "U+".

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SAC_COMPAT_IDENT

      static final short SAC_COMPAT_IDENT
      Compat identifier: invalid value accepted for IE compatibility as an ident-like value.
      See Also:
      getStringValue(), Constant Field Values

    • SAC_COMPAT_PRIO

      static final short SAC_COMPAT_PRIO
      Value with invalid priority accepted for IE compatibility, but it is interpreted as being of !important priority by the compatible browsers, which makes it different from SAC_COMPAT_IDENT.
      See Also:
      getStringValue(), Constant Field Values

    • SAC_ELEMENT_REFERENCE

      static final short SAC_ELEMENT_REFERENCE
      An element reference.

      For example: element(#someId).

      See Also:
      getStringValue(), Constant Field Values

    • SAC_INITIAL

      static final short SAC_INITIAL
      Keyword initial.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SAC_UNSET

      static final short SAC_UNSET
      Keyword unset.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SAC_REVERT

      static final short SAC_REVERT
      Keyword revert.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SAC_CONDITION_AND

      static final short SAC_CONDITION_AND
      AND condition.

      Can be cast to a BooleanCondition of type AND.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SAC_CONDITION_OR

      static final short SAC_CONDITION_OR
      OR condition.

      Can be cast to a BooleanCondition of type OR.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SAC_CONDITION_NOT

      static final short SAC_CONDITION_NOT
      NOT condition.

      Can be cast to a BooleanCondition of type NOT.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SAC_CONDITION_PREDICATE

      static final short SAC_CONDITION_PREDICATE
      Fundamental PREDICATE inside a condition.

      Can be cast to a BooleanCondition of type PREDICATE.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • SAC_VAR

      static final short SAC_VAR
      Custom property value: var(...).

      See getStringValue() for the custom property name, and getParameters() for the fallback.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getLexicalUnitType

      short getLexicalUnitType()
      An integer indicating the type of LexicalUnit.
      Returns:
      the type of LexicalUnit.

    • getCssUnit

      short getCssUnit()
      An integer indicating the type of css unit that this lexical value represents.
      Returns:
      an integer indicating the type of css unit. If this value does not represent a dimension, must return an invalid unit identifier.

    • getNextLexicalUnit

      LexicalUnit getNextLexicalUnit()
      The next lexical unit.

      Lexical units can form chains of units which can be traversed with getNextLexicalUnit() and getPreviousLexicalUnit().

      Returns:
      the next lexical unit, or null if none.

    • getPreviousLexicalUnit

      LexicalUnit getPreviousLexicalUnit()
      The previous lexical unit.

      See also getNextLexicalUnit().

      Returns:
      the previous lexical unit, or null if none.

    • insertNextLexicalUnit

      void insertNextLexicalUnit​(LexicalUnit nextUnit)
      Insert the given unit as the next lexical unit.

      After the insertion, nextUnit shall be the next lexical unit, and the former next lexical unit will be the next one after the last unit in the nextUnit unit chain.

      Parameters:
      nextUnit - the lexical unit to be set as the next one.

    • replaceBy

      LexicalUnit replaceBy​(LexicalUnit replacementUnit)
      Replace this unit in the chain of lexical units.
      Parameters:
      replacementUnit - the lexical unit that replaces this one.
      Returns:
      the unit that replaces this one.

    • getIntegerValue

      int getIntegerValue()
      Returns the integer value represented by this unit.
      Returns:
      the integer value, or zero if this is not an integer unit.
      See Also:
      SAC_INTEGER

    • getFloatValue

      float getFloatValue()
      Returns the float value represented by this unit.
      Returns:
      the float value, or NaN if this value is not a float.

    • getDimensionUnitText

      java.lang.String getDimensionUnitText()
      If this unit is a SAC_DIMENSION, returns the string representation of the CSS unit returned by getCssUnit().
      Returns:
      the string representation of the CSS unit, or the empty string if this lexical unit does not represent a SAC_DIMENSION.

    • getStringValue

      java.lang.String getStringValue()
      Returns the string value.

      If the type is SAC_URI, the return value doesn't contain uri(....) or quotes.

      If the type is SAC_ATTR, the return value doesn't contain attr(....).

      If the type is SAC_UNICODE_WILDCARD, the return value is the wildcard without the preceding "U+".

      Returns:
      the string value, or null if this unit does not have a string to return.
      See Also:
      SAC_URI, SAC_ATTR, SAC_IDENT, SAC_STRING_VALUE, SAC_UNICODE_WILDCARD

    • getFunctionName

      java.lang.String getFunctionName()
      Returns the name of the function.
      Returns:
      the function name, or null if this unit is not a function.
      See Also:
      SAC_COUNTER_FUNCTION, SAC_COUNTERS_FUNCTION, SAC_RECT_FUNCTION, SAC_FUNCTION, SAC_RGBCOLOR

    • getParameters

      LexicalUnit getParameters()
      The function parameters including operators (like the comma). #000 is converted to rgb(0, 0, 0) can return null if SAC_FUNCTION.
      Returns:
      the parameters of this function, or null if this unit is not a function.
      See Also:
      SAC_COUNTER_FUNCTION, SAC_COUNTERS_FUNCTION, SAC_RECT_FUNCTION, SAC_FUNCTION, SAC_RGBCOLOR

    • isParameter

      boolean isParameter()
      Check if this lexical unit is a parameter that was made available through its parent's getParameters() method.
      Returns:
      true if this lexical unit is a parameter.

    • getSubValues

      LexicalUnit getSubValues()
      Returns a sequence of units inside the sub-expression or unicode range.
      Returns:
      the values in the sub-expression, or null if this unit is not a sub-expression nor a unicode range.
      See Also:
      SAC_SUB_EXPRESSION, SAC_UNICODERANGE

    • getCssText

      java.lang.String getCssText()
      Get a parsable representation of this unit.

      The serialization must only include this lexical unit, ignoring the next units if they exist.

      The text should be close to how the value was specified (for example, preserving hex or functional notation in rgb colors) but must parse without errors (except for compatibility values like SAC_COMPAT_IDENT).

      Returns:
      the parsable representation of this unit.

    • clone

      LexicalUnit clone()
      Creates a deep copy of this lexical unit and the next ones, but with getPreviousLexicalUnit() returning null.
      Returns:
      a copy of this unit.
